TextBody:
Hi Taeyoung,

Thanks for reaching out!
Usually, this is set up by the customer in the SIEM solution they use. Could you please check if you have a location setting on your SIEM solution?

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000HsW7f:ref

Hi Botond,

My settings are here. Syslog server was built in Azure VM (Ubuntu 24.04 / Rsyslog)
I opened inbond port 514 TCP and set Rsyslog 514 tcp as well.
The VM’s public IP is 20.43.241.69

In EPP settings, I set like below.
[cid:image001.png@01DB2F8B.6D53A700]
I would like to ask your thought about the setting. If you think something is not correct, please give me advice.
Thank you so much

Best,
Taeyoung

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000HsW7f:ref

Hi. Botond

I haven’t used Ubuntu OS before. In that mind,  I uninstalled rsyslog and installed syslog-ng.
However when I tried to see status of syslog-ng. It failed starting.
Depending on various search, I have tried couple things that the search recommends.But all failed.
I feel I messed up this ubuntu vm machine.

Is there any way I can get remote help that your engineer access my computer via Zoom or Teams.
If yes, I can factory reset this Ubuntu VM in Azure and let you play in clean environment.

Please let me know.
Thank you


Taeyoung Goo | IT Desktop/Lab Support Engineer

Hi Taeyoung,

Unfortunately we cannot troubleshoot issues on the SIEM server side.
The EPP server is working with a lot of different SIEM solutions for our customers.
We can have a remote session to check if the EPP server communicates with your SIEM server.

Best regards,
